name: LightTag
description: A tool for managing annotation projects. Handles right-to-left and part-of-word marking. `Tutorial video here <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eTlrTC_n_yg>

name: Recogito
description: A tool for linked data annotation.

name: CATMA
description: A web-based tool for research and collaboration over text data. Handles right-to-left and part-of-word marking.
url: http://catma.de/ See the system itself here: http://portal.catma.de/catma/ And the code here: https://github.com/mpetris/catma

name: WebAnno
description: Web-based. Support RTL and project management. Repository: https://github.com/webanno/webanno

name: Arethusa
description: A backend-independent client-side annotation framework. `Repository here <https://github.com/alpheios-project/arethusa>

name: rasa-nlu-trainer
description: A tool to edit training examples for `rasa NLU <https://github.com/rasahq/rasa_nlu> Handles right-to-left and part-of-word marking.

name: brat
description: An online environment for collaborative text annotation. Does not support right-to-left. `Repository here <https://github.com/nlplab/brat>

name: pybossa
description: A framework for crowdsourcing of data analysis and enrichment tasks. `GitHub <https://github.com/Scifabric/pybossa>

name: TextThrasher
description: A crowdsourced text annotator. Built with React and Redux (possibly also with pybossa).

name: SHEBANQ
description: System for HEBrew Text: ANnotations for Queries and Markup. SHEBANQ is an online environment for studying the Hebrew Bible.

name: doccano
description: an open source text annotation tool for humans. It provides annotation features for text classification, sequence labeling and sequence to sequence tasks. So, you can create labeled data for sentiment analysis, named entity recognition, text summarization and so on.
